discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
AD refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 22
AD, C is underlay. Study guide page 22.

questions.question_text: Which two interfaces are considered overlay links? (Choose two.)

choices.D: SD-WAN does not monitor the health and performance of ADVPN shortcuts.
choices.C: Routes for ADVPN shortcuts must be manually configured.
choices.B: SD-WAN can steer traffic to ADVPN shortcuts established over IPsec overlays configured as SD-WAN members.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 224

questions.question_text: Which statement is correct about SD-WAN and ADVPN?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
BD refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 56

questions.question_text: Which two statements about SLA targets and SD-WAN rules are true? (Choose two.)

choices.C: When configuring an SD-WAN rule, you can select multiple SLA targets of the same performance SLA.
choices.D: SD-WAN rules use SLA targets to check if the preferred members meet the SLA requirements.
choices.A: Member metrics are measured only if an SLA target is configured.
choices.B: SLA targets are used only by SD-WAN rules that are configured with Lowest Cost (SLA) or Maximize Bandwidth (SLA) as strategy.

questions.question_text: Which diagnostic command can you use to show interface-specific SLA logs for the last 10 minutes?

discussion.content: C is correct as diagnose sys sdwan sla-log used to check SLA metrics for last 10 minutes
6.4 study 105 clearly states "interface-specific"=intf-sla-log, vs "performance-SLA"=sla-log, ao it's C.

D is the correct answer.
Study guide 7.0:
You can view the stored member metrics by running the diagnose sys sdwan sla-log command. Note
that you must indicate the name of the performance SLA followed by the member configuration index number.
To display the stored member utilization, you run the diagnose sys sdwan intf-sla-log command.

Selected Answer: C
C refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 104

I think correct answer is D
diagnose sys sdwan intf-sla-log -> shows only bandwidth utilization
diagnose sys sdwan sla-log -> shows packet-loss, latency, jitter, MOS

Selected Answer: BD
BD refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 150

questions.question_text: Which two statements about SD-WAN central management are true? (Choose two.)

choices.D: It uses templates to configure SD-WAN on managed devices.
choices.A: It does not allow you to monitor the status of SD-WAN members.
choices.B: It is enabled or disabled on a per-ADOM basis.
